abstract: The deterioration of the bank’s position accelerated in the last four trading days as investors took advantage of its distress.
snippet: The deterioration of the bank’s position accelerated in the last four trading days as investors took advantage of its distress.
lead_paragraph: The trading losses suffered by JPMorgan Chase have surged in recent days, surpassing the bank’s initial $2 billion estimate by at least $1 billion, according to people with knowledge of the losses.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Trading Loss Is Said to Rise at Least 50%

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

abstract: Since the company operates with implicit government backing, its recent trading losses demand an independent inquiry on five specific questions, an economist writes.
snippet: Since the company operates with implicit government backing, its recent trading losses demand an independent inquiry on five specific questions, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

abstract: A multibillion-dollar trading loss at JPMorgan may remind some of the disaster at the Long Term Capital Management hedge fund in 1998.
snippet: A multibillion-dollar trading loss at JPMorgan may remind some of the disaster at the Long Term Capital Management hedge fund in 1998.

headline.main: Lessons From Trades Big and Bad
headline.print_headline: Lessons From Trades Big and Bad

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, will appear before a Senate Banking Committee hearing that will look at the bank’s surprise trading loss.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, will appear before a Senate Banking Committee hearing that will look at the bank’s surprise trading loss.

headline.main: Dimon to Appear Before Senate Panel

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Nelson D. Schwartz

abstract: As with the Martha Stewart criminal case, any false statement that JPMorgan employees and executives make to a government official can be the basis for a prosecution.
snippet: As with the Martha Stewart criminal case, any false statement that JPMorgan employees and executives make to a government official can be the basis for a prosecution.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase’s woes continue to grow after its disclosure of losses from a failed hedging strategy in its corporate bond portfolio. The bank is already the subject of an inquiry by the Securities and Exchange Commission, and now the Federal Bureau of Investigation has opened a preliminary criminal investigation.

headline.main: Where Prosecutors Might Focus in Their JPMorgan Inquiries
